snippet: Michael Poventud’s conviction for the attempted murder and attempted robbery of a Bronx cabdriver was reversed after he spent nine years in prison, but he pleaded guilty to a lesser charge.
abstract: Judge Richard C Wesley of United States Court of Appeals for Second Circuit rules that Michael Poventud, whose 1988 conviction for attempted murder and attempted robbery of Bronx cabdriver was reversed after he spent nine years in prison, could still sue city for violating his rights.
lead_paragraph: Michael Poventud’s conviction for the attempted murder and attempted robbery of a Bronx cabdriver was reversed after he spent nine years in prison, but he pleaded guilty to a lesser charge.

headline.main: Despite a Guilty Plea, a Ruling Allows a Man to Sue New York City
headline.print_headline: Despite Guilty Plea After Reversed Conviction, Court Rules That Man Can Sue City
